memberDescription: [u"I began traveling nearly full-time in my teens, and continue to travel as much as possible. I will travel just about anywhere that I get the chance. Being an archaeologist, I especially enjoy visiting archaeological sites, even as a tourist. I also enjoy hiking, photography, and museums. I absolutely do not enjoy shopping. I enjoy learning about and trying local foods, even the ones that fellow travelers might consider more unusual. I try to get a sense of the local culture wherever I go. I can't see going somewhere just to experience the same things I can when I'm home. "]

ownerdesc: In the heart of affluent Uptown lies a genuine in-town neighborhood catering to the urban dwellers of Dallas. This is a place where bustling cafes, restaurants and lounges spill onto the streets. Sidewalks lined with trees accommodate the strolling shoppers. Discover local, homegrown boutiques here, as well as timeless classics. The classic American architecture offers a creative-edge and an enduring spirit. Since opening in 2001, the development has added two additional phases with its largest expansion yet to come. West Village is an evolving, walkable shopping and dining district.
review: This is a pretty urban place to be. The shopping is good, there's a good selection of shops, such as the Loft & Brooks Brothers. There's a Starbucks onsite and a grocery store just south of the Village, on McKinney. At night, it gets very busy and the restaurants are very trendy. I really enjoyed our trips to here.

ownerdesc: Named as one of the "7 Retail Wonders of the Modern World" by Shopping Centers Today, NorthPark Center offers an unparalleled luxury shopping experience with 225 unique retailers, restaurants and legendary department stores set amid a magnificent setting of internationally acclaimed 20th and 21st century art, award-winning architecture and extraordinary landscaping. In 2012, NorthPark Center surpassed $1 billion in total overall sales placing it among the top five performing shopping centers in the United States. In 2006, NorthPark Center completed a $250 million expansion, which included the addition of 1.2-million-square-feet of retail, restaurant and community space, a 1.4-acre sculpture garden, CenterPark, and a state-of-the-art movie theatre, AMC NorthPark 15. NorthPark Center is the largest shopping center in North Texas with over 2 million square feet. NorthPark Center is five miles north of downtown Dallas, 30 miles east of Fort Worth and at the center of it all with convenient access to surrounding suburbs. Dallas Love Field Airport and Dallas Fort Worth International Airport are both located within 20 minutes.
review:
I've visited this mall annually for about 35 years now.

memberDescription: [u'For years, I traveled predominately on business. As of late, my travels are driven for personal purposes or joining my husband on business. Although I prefer traveling internationally, staying in the community and getting to know the people, my husband enjoys US locals or cruising, enjoying creature comforts, and staying at resorts or high end accommodations. As a family, we enjoy roughing it in the outdoors or in a cabin, sharing with our kids and their loved ones. With this in mind, it is my aim to provide you a varied and diverse experience to draw upon when preparing my reviews. ']

ownerdesc: Named as one of the "7 Retail Wonders of the Modern World" by Shopping Centers Today, NorthPark Center offers an unparalleled luxury shopping experience with 225 unique retailers, restaurants and legendary department stores set amid a magnificent setting of internationally acclaimed 20th and 21st century art, award-winning architecture and extraordinary landscaping. In 2012, NorthPark Center surpassed $1 billion in total overall sales placing it among the top five performing shopping centers in the United States. In 2006, NorthPark Center completed a $250 million expansion, which included the addition of 1.2-million-square-feet of retail, restaurant and community space, a 1.4-acre sculpture garden, CenterPark, and a state-of-the-art movie theatre, AMC NorthPark 15. NorthPark Center is the largest shopping center in North Texas with over 2 million square feet. NorthPark Center is five miles north of downtown Dallas, 30 miles east of Fort Worth and at the center of it all with convenient access to surrounding suburbs. Dallas Love Field Airport and Dallas Fort Worth International Airport are both located within 20 minutes.
review: My Favorite mall to go to plus when my wife is still shopping and I'm finished i can always go to the Tesla store and check out a car.

name: jtchapman

memberDescription:
[u'I am a retired Rocket Scientist. Spent 33 years at NASA-JSC.
My posts are HONEST. No punches pulled.
Martha and I travel well. Our travel phiolsophy: "Travel well and travel often. It doesn't cost any more to go first class - you just can't go as far!!!" My travel agent understands this.
We considered getting a big 'ole RV with a trailing jeep. For the money and the hassle, we are happier going on 3-4 good trips per year. Life is a trade-off. Happy with our choice.
Just got on TripAdvisor a little while back. Some of my reviews are old but I hope still prescient. They don't let you go past since 2011 to post. I try and date my reviews.
We've been to a lot of GREAT places in our travels over the years. Hope to continue and share my honest opinions.
My travel map shows places we've been to eat or stay and attractions we have visited. I DON'T count locations or show places we just passed thru!
J.T. ']

memberDescription:
[u'Retired and off to see EVERYTHING in the U.S. Update 5/2013: I have tried Road Scholar (Retired persons lecture series) tours, Cosmos bus tours, an Alaskan cruise, a Caribbean exercise cruise, and many solo trips in the last 2 years. I have been to all 50 states, 49 state capitol buildings, 13 Presidential libraries, and 21 National Parks and Monuments. What fun!
I am branching out into Canada. I have been to 7 of the 10 provinces, 5 Legislative Buildings (capitols), the national Parliament in Ottawa, and 8 of their National Parks.
2014: I have a new goal. I want to visit all of the National Parks in the U.S. There are 53, and I have been to 21 of them.
']

name: EpicureanFunTraveler
CitiesVisited: Honolulu, HI, USA,Las Vegas, NV, USA,Oahu, HI, USA,Maui, HI, USA,Kauai, HI, USA,Island of Hawaii, HI, USA,Kailua, HI, USA,Orlando, FL, USA,Palm Springs, CA, USA,Hilo, HI, USA,Kailua-Kona, HI, USA,Dallas, TX, USA,
memberDescription:
[u"I travel for travels sake. I am happy going to Hawaii or Vegas for the 6th time in a year and more excited visiting a new destination. I enjoy experiencing life like locals, but prefer sleeping at the Ritz. I like having lunch at a local hangout, but find solace having afternoon tea on the concierge floor.
I've visited over 100 countries. My goal is to make 150.
I'm one of less than 3,000 who have made it to the North Pole. While I have been fortunate to step foot on Antartica I have yet to stand on the South Pole.
I keep a list of places I want to travel and of things I want to do in life.
I enjoy talking with and meeting other people who enjoy travel. I am just as happy talking about flying first class or in a private jet as I am discussing the benefits of saving money.
I can usual be found at one of my homes in Hawaii, Guatemala, Palm Springs, or Vegas. I have my eye on Kauai and Bali.
I like combining travel with helping locals. Giving back is wonderful.
Share joy :) "]
review:
This is a locals park for people in the neighborhood. However, I could see somebody coming here and relaxing while pondering life or reading a book.
I enjoyed walking around and looking at the various statutes and enjoying a cup of coffee while listening to the water fountain in the shape of a dragon.
Very nice place for peaceful meditation.

So what am I looking for when reviewing here on tripadvisor for restaurants:
1) greeting by hostess
2) timely manner of server coming by after being seated.
3) never asking for refills on soft drinks and water.
4) server coming back and checking on us before, during and after meal.
5) attitude of server (are they all smiles or do they make you feel like an inconvenience)!
6) presentation of food, food tempreture, how long food took to arrive, taste and size (too much or too small)
7) restaurant cleanliness also of plates, silverware, and glasses.
Really all the basics :) purrs "]
review:
Have seen a few concerts here and I have to say I love the area and how easy it is get to. Pay for parking at the Audi garage...worth it. name: jtchapman
CitiesVisited: London, UK,Houston, TX, USA,Stavanger, Norway,Miami Beach, FL, USA,San Antonio, TX, USA,Austin, TX, USA,Seattle, WA, USA,Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada,Molde, Norway,Blowing Point, Anguilla,Savannah, GA, USA,Broadway, UK,
memberDescription:
[u'I am a retired Rocket Scientist. Spent 33 years at NASA-JSC.
My posts are HONEST. No punches pulled.
Martha and I travel well. Our travel phiolsophy: "Travel well and travel often. It doesn't cost any more to go first class - you just can't go as far!!!" My travel agent understands this.
We considered getting a big 'ole RV with a trailing jeep. For the money and the hassle, we are happier going on 3-4 good trips per year. Life is a trade-off. Happy with our choice.
Just got on TripAdvisor a little while back. Some of my reviews are old but I hope still prescient. They don't let you go past since 2011 to post. I try and date my reviews.
We've been to a lot of GREAT places in our travels over the years. Hope to continue and share my honest opinions.
My travel map shows places we've been to eat or stay and attractions we have visited. I DON'T count locations or show places we just passed thru!
J.T. ']
review: Spent four years here 50 years ago to get my BSEE. The campus has changed a lot but still has the same feel. Kinda nice to go back home.
